result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole G Shafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant shall actively seek, obtain & maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both that is full-time
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment within 30 days and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  If the def has already completed an assessment, she doesn't need to do another one
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician

The defendant is not to be on any premises where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used or sold

No Contact with any known users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

No Contact with Cyrus C - PO can modify the No Contact if deemed appropriate
.

Comply with mental health treatment and follow-through

Complete any other counseling or programming deemed necessary by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 28 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
